meanings.sent1: The operculum of the jar kept the cookies fresh.
meanings.sent2: She carefully lifted the operculum of the box to reveal its contents.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to hide under the operculum of the laundry basket.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like an operculum, hiding his true feelings underneath.
meanings.sent5: The operculum of the treasure chest gleamed in the sunlight, tempting the curious explorers.

meanings.definition: A structure that closes or covers an opening
meanings.sent1: The operculum of the mailbox swung open with a creak.
meanings.sent2: The operculum of the flower bud protected it from the harsh wind.
meanings.sent3: The operculum of the tent zipper got stuck, causing a funny situation.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an operculum, closing off any sadness around her.
meanings.sent5: The operculum of the cave entrance loomed ominously, daring the adventurers to enter.

meanings.definition: A flap of tissue covering the gills of certain aquatic organisms
meanings.sent1: The operculum of the fish moved rhythmically as it breathed underwater.
meanings.sent2: The operculum of the crab protected its delicate gills from harm.
meanings.sent3: The operculum of the sea creature fluttered like a tiny flag in the water.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like an operculum, soothing and calming those around her.
meanings.sent5: The operculum of the seahorse shimmered in the ocean currents, a beautiful sight to behold.
